% Define support macros for attaching opening and closing lines to notebooks
\newsavebox\nbsphinxbox
\makeatletter
\newcommand{\nbsphinxstartnotebook}[1]{%
    \par
    % measure needed space
    \setbox\nbsphinxbox\vtop{{#1\par}}
    % reserve some space at bottom of page, else start new page
    \needspace{\dimexpr2.5\baselineskip+\ht\nbsphinxbox+\dp\nbsphinxbox}
    % mimick vertical spacing from \section command
      \addpenalty\@secpenalty
      \@tempskipa 3.5ex \@plus 1ex \@minus .2ex\relax
      \addvspace\@tempskipa
      {\Large\@tempskipa\baselineskip
             \advance\@tempskipa-\prevdepth
             \advance\@tempskipa-\ht\nbsphinxbox
             \ifdim\@tempskipa>\z@
               \vskip \@tempskipa
             \fi}
    \unvbox\nbsphinxbox
    % if notebook starts with a \section, prevent it from adding extra space
    \@nobreaktrue\everypar{\@nobreakfalse\everypar{}}%
    % compensate the parskip which will get inserted by next paragraph
    \nobreak\vskip-\parskip
    % do not break here
    \nobreak
}% end of \nbsphinxstartnotebook

\newcommand{\nbsphinxstopnotebook}[1]{%
    \par
    % measure needed space
    \setbox\nbsphinxbox\vbox{{#1\par}}
    \nobreak % it updates page totals
    \dimen@\pagegoal
    \advance\dimen@-\pagetotal \advance\dimen@-\pagedepth
    \advance\dimen@-\ht\nbsphinxbox \advance\dimen@-\dp\nbsphinxbox
    \ifdim\dimen@<\z@
      % little space left
      \unvbox\nbsphinxbox
      \kern-.8\baselineskip
      \nobreak\vskip\z@\@plus1fil
      \penalty100
      \vskip\z@\@plus-1fil
      \kern.8\baselineskip
    \else
      \unvbox\nbsphinxbox
    \fi
}% end of \nbsphinxstopnotebook

% Ensure height of an included graphics fits in nbsphinxfancyoutput frame
\newdimen\nbsphinx@image@maxheight % set in nbsphinxfancyoutput environment
\newcommand*{\nbsphinxincludegraphics}[2][]{%
    \gdef\spx@includegraphics@options{#1}%
    \setbox\spx@image@box\hbox{\includegraphics[#1,draft]{#2}}%
    \in@false
    \ifdim \wd\spx@image@box>\linewidth
      \g@addto@macro\spx@includegraphics@options{,width=\linewidth}%
      \in@true
    \fi
    % no rotation, no need to worry about depth
    \ifdim \ht\spx@image@box>\nbsphinx@image@maxheight
      \g@addto@macro\spx@includegraphics@options{,height=\nbsphinx@image@maxheight}%
      \in@true
    \fi
    \ifin@
      \g@addto@macro\spx@includegraphics@options{,keepaspectratio}%
    \fi
    \setbox\spx@image@box\box\voidb@x % clear memory
    \expandafter\includegraphics\expandafter[\spx@includegraphics@options]{#2}%
}% end of "\MakeFrame"-safe variant of \sphinxincludegraphics
\makeatother

\title{OptiSuite\sphinxhyphen{}OptiApp}

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index::doc}}


This is a template for a simple optimization project

\noindent\sphinxincludegraphics[width=400\sphinxpxdimen]{{images/opti}.png}


\chapter{How to run the library}
\label{\detokenize{index:how-to-run-the-library}}\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{)}%
\item {} 
Create an input data instance from a json file:
\begin{quote}

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{from opti\_suite.opti\_app.factory.model\_data\_factory import ModelDataFactory}}

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{data = ModelDataFactory.create\_from\_json\_file(input\_json=\textless{}file\sphinxhyphen{}path\sphinxhyphen{}to\sphinxhyphen{}json\sphinxhyphen{}input\textgreater{})}}
\end{quote}

\item {} 
Create and instance of the optimization engine with the input data and execute:
\begin{quote}

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{from opti\_suite.opti\_app.model.engine import Engine}}

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{engine = Engine(data=data)}}

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{engine.execute()}}
\end{quote}

\item {} 
Get the response in json format:
\begin{quote}

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{json\_response = engine.generate\_json\_response()}}
\end{quote}

\end{enumerate}

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{This class defines the optimization engine for build and solve the optimization problem}}
\begin{quote}

\sphinxstyleemphasis{Attributes}:
\begin{quote}

\sphinxstyleemphasis{status} :
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Status of the optimization execution.}}

\sphinxstyleemphasis{model} :
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Instance of the optimization model.}}

\sphinxstyleemphasis{data} :
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{A ModelData data instance.}}

\sphinxstyleemphasis{response} :
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{A ModelResponse data instance.}}

\sphinxstyleemphasis{results} :
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Optimization model results}}
\end{quote}

\sphinxstyleemphasis{Methods}:
\begin{quote}

\sphinxstyleemphasis{execute} :
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Run DataAnalyzer with the instance DataModel, build the model, solve the model and build
model response.}}

\sphinxstyleemphasis{get\_response} :
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Get the ModelResponse instance generated with the ModelResponseFactory with solution of saved in
ModelData.}}

\sphinxstyleemphasis{generate\_json\_response} :
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Get the json response with the solution.}}

\sphinxstyleemphasis{generate\_excel\_response} :
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Get the excel response with the solution.}}

\sphinxstyleemphasis{generate\_solver\_factory}
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Generate solver factory based on the solver choose}}

\sphinxstyleemphasis{has\_solution}
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Check if the solver founded a solution and the quality of the solution}}
\end{quote}
\end{quote}

\chapter{Model Data}
\label{\detokenize{index:module-opti_suite.opti_app.context.model_data}}\label{\detokenize{index:model-data}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!opti\_suite.opti\_app.context.model\_data@\spxentry{opti\_suite.opti\_app.context.model\_data}}\index{opti\_suite.opti\_app.context.model\_data@\spxentry{opti\_suite.opti\_app.context.model\_data}!module@\spxentry{module}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:module-1}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!opti\_suite.opti\_app.context.model\_data@\spxentry{opti\_suite.opti\_app.context.model\_data}}\index{opti\_suite.opti\_app.context.model\_data@\spxentry{opti\_suite.opti\_app.context.model\_data}!module@\spxentry{module}}\index{ModelData (class in opti\_suite.opti\_app.context.model\_data)@\spxentry{ModelData}\spxextra{class in opti\_suite.opti\_app.context.model\_data}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:opti_suite.opti_app.context.model_data.ModelData}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{opti\_suite.opti\_app.context.model\_data.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{ModelData}}}
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{This class defines the data class ModelData for the optimization library.
It contains the structures of input data for the optimization problem, loaded from the input request
as well as the solution data.}}
\begin{quote}

\sphinxstyleemphasis{Attributes}:
\begin{quote}
\begin{quote}

\sphinxstyleemphasis{workers} :
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Dataframe with the input data for unit workers.}}

\sphinxstyleemphasis{periods} :
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Dataframe with the input data planning periods.}}

\sphinxstyleemphasis{shifts} :
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Dictionary with the time periods for each shift.}}

\sphinxstyleemphasis{shifts\_list} :
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{List of shifts.}}

\sphinxstyleemphasis{configuration} :
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Configuration parameters (dataframe).}}

\sphinxstyleemphasis{solution\_schedules\_worker} :
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Dictionary with the schedule solution of workers.}}

\sphinxstyleemphasis{solution\_necessary\_worker} :
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Dictionary with the scheduled workers.}}
\end{quote}

\begin{quote}

\sphinxstyleemphasis{set\_workers}

\sphinxstyleemphasis{set\_periods}

\sphinxstyleemphasis{add\_solution\_needed\_worker}

\sphinxstyleemphasis{get\_solution\_needed\_worker}
\end{quote}
\end{quote}
\end{quote}

\chapter{Model Response}
